   20: 
   21: -module(code_SUITE).
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23:          versions/1,new_binary_types/1,
   24:          bad_beam_file/1,
   25:          literal_leak/1,
   26:          call_purged_fun_code_gone/1,
   27:          call_purged_fun_code_reload/1,
   28:          call_purged_fun_code_there/1,
   29:          call_purged_fun_code_altered/1,
   30:          multi_proc_purge/1, t_check_old_code/1,
   31:          external_fun/1,get_chunk/1,module_md5/1,
   32:          constant_pools/1,constant_refc_binaries/1,
   33:          fake_literals/1,
   34:          false_dependency/1,coverage/1,fun_confusion/1,
   35:          t_copy_literals/1, t_copy_literals_frags/1,
   36:          erl_544/1, max_heap_size/1,
   37:          check_process_code_signal_order/1,
   38:          check_process_code_dirty_exec_proc/1,
   39:          call_fun_before_load/1]).
   40: 
   41: -define(line_trace, 1).
   42: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   43: 
   44: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   45: 
   46: all() ->
   47:     [versions, new_binary_types,
   48:      bad_beam_file, literal_leak,
   49:      call_purged_fun_code_gone,
   50:      call_purged_fun_code_reload, call_purged_fun_code_there,
   51:      call_purged_fun_code_altered,
   52:      multi_proc_purge, t_check_old_code, external_fun, get_chunk,
   53:      module_md5,
   54:      constant_pools, constant_refc_binaries, fake_literals,
   55:      false_dependency,
   56:      coverage, fun_confusion, t_copy_literals, t_copy_literals_frags,
   57:      erl_544, max_heap_size, check_process_code_signal_order,
   58:      check_process_code_dirty_exec_proc, call_fun_before_load].
   59: 
   60: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   61:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
   62:     Config.
   63: 
   64: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   65:     catch erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
   66:     ok.
   67: 
   68: %% Make sure that only two versions of a module can be loaded.
   69: versions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   70:     V1 = compile_version(1, Config),
   71:     V2 = compile_version(2, Config),
   72:     V3 = compile_version(3, Config),
   73: 
   74:     {ok,P1,1} = load_version(V1, 1),
   75:     {ok,P2,2} = load_version(V2, 2),
   76:     {error,not_purged} = load_version(V2, 2),
   77:     {error,not_purged} = load_version(V3, 3),
   78: 
   79:     1 = check_version(P1),
   80:     2 = check_version(P2),
   81:     2 = versions:version(),
   82: 
   83:     %% Kill processes, unload code.
   84:     _ = monitor(process, P1),
   85:     _ = monitor(process, P2),
   86:     P1 ! P2 ! done,
   87:     receive
   88:         {'DOWN',_,process,P1,normal} -> ok
   89:     end,
   90:     receive
   91:         {'DOWN',_,process,P2,normal} -> ok
   92:     end,
   93:     true = erlang:purge_module(versions),
   94:     true = erlang:delete_module(versions),
   95:     true = erlang:purge_module(versions),
   96:     ok.
   97: 
   98: compile_version(Version, Config) ->
   99:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  100:     File = filename:join(Data, "versions"),
  101:     {ok,versions,Bin} = compile:file(File, [{d,'VERSION',Version},
  102:                                             binary,report]),
  103:     Bin.
  104: 
  105: load_version(Code, Ver) ->
  106:     case erlang:load_module(versions, Code) of
  107:         {module,versions} ->
  108:             Pid = spawn_link(versions, loop, []),
  109:             Ver = versions:version(),
  110:             Ver = check_version(Pid),
  111:             {ok,Pid,Ver};
  112:         Error ->
  113:             Error
  114:     end.
  115: 
  116: check_version(Pid) ->
  117:     Pid ! {self(),version},
  118:     receive
  119:         {Pid,version,Version} ->
  120:             Version
  121:     end.
  122: 
  123: new_binary_types(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  124:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  125:     File = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  126:     {ok,my_code_test,Bin} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  127:     {module,my_code_test} = erlang:load_module(my_code_test,
  128:                                                make_sub_binary(Bin)),
  129:     true = erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  130:     true = erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  131: 
  132:     {module,my_code_test} = erlang:load_module(my_code_test,
  133:                                                make_unaligned_sub_binary(Bin)),
  134:     true = erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  135:     true = erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  136: 
  137:     %% Try heap binaries and bad binaries.
  138:     {error,badfile} = erlang:load_module(my_code_test, <<1,2>>),
  139:     {error,badfile} = erlang:load_module(my_code_test,
  140:                                          make_sub_binary(<<1,2>>)),
  141:     {error,badfile} = erlang:load_module(my_code_test,
  142:                                          make_unaligned_sub_binary(<<1,2>>)),
  143:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:load_module(my_code_test,
  144:                                                     bit_sized_binary(Bin))),
  145:     ok.
  146: 
  147: %% Ensure that the loader doesn't crash or leak memory when attempting
  148: %% to load bad BEAM files. We depend on valgrind to notice leaks.
  149: bad_beam_file(_Config) ->
  150:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  151: 
  152:     BadBeam1 = bad_beam_file_1(Mod),
  153:     {error,badfile} = code:load_binary(Mod, atom_to_list(Mod), BadBeam1),
  154: 
  155:     BadBeam2 = bad_beam_file_2(Mod),
  156:     {error,badfile} = code:load_binary(Mod, atom_to_list(Mod), BadBeam2),
  157: 
  158:     ok.
  159: 
  160: %% Build a BEAM file with an invalid instruction in the code chunk.
  161: bad_beam_file_1(Mod) ->
  162:     Exp = [{term,0}],
  163:     Attr = [],
  164:     Fs = [{function,term,0,3,
  165:            [{label,1},
  166:             {line,[]},
  167:             {func_info,{atom,Mod},{atom,term},0},
  168:             {label,2},
  169:             {move,nil,nil},                     %Illegal destination.
  170:             return]}],
  171:     Asm = {Mod,Exp,Attr,Fs,3},
  172: 
  173:     %% Bypass beam_validator.
  174:     {ok,BadBeam} = beam_asm:module(Asm, [], [], []),
  175:     BadBeam.
  176: 
  177: %% Build a BEAM file with an invalid attributes chunk.
  178: bad_beam_file_2(Mod) ->
  179:     Asm = {Mod,[],[],[],1},
  180:     {ok,BadBeam0} = beam_asm:module(Asm, [], [], []),
  181:     {ok, Mod, Chunks0} = beam_lib:all_chunks(BadBeam0),
  182:     Chunks1 = lists:keydelete("Attr", 1, Chunks0),
  183:     Chunks = [{"Attr",<<"bad_attribute_chunk">>} | Chunks1],
  184:     {ok,BadBeam} = beam_lib:build_module(Chunks),
  185:     BadBeam.
  186: 
  187: %% Ensure that literal areas don't leak when erlang:prepare_loading/2
  188: %% is not followed by erlang:finish_loading/1.
  189: literal_leak(_Config) ->
  190:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  191:     HugeLiteral = binary_to_list(<<0:(1024*1024)/unit:8>>),
  192:     Exp = [{term,0}],
  193:     Attr = [],
  194:     Fs = [{function,term,0,3,
  195:            [{label,1},
  196:             {line,[]},
  197:             {func_info,{atom,Mod},{atom,term},0},
  198:             {label,2},
  199:             {move,{literal,HugeLiteral},{x,0}},
  200:             return]}],
  201:     Asm = {Mod,Exp,Attr,Fs,3},
  202:     {ok,Beam} = beam_asm:module(Asm, [], [], []),
  203: 
  204:     %% valgrind cannot help us find leak of literals because literal
  205:     %% areas are allocated using mmap().
  206:     %%
  207:     %% Instead we will prepare for loading a BEAM file with a 16Mb
  208:     %% literal N times so that the reserved literal memory range will
  209:     %% overflow.
  210:     %%
  211:     %% Setting N to 64 is sufficient for overflowing a 1 GB literal
  212:     %% area (which is the size at the time of writing). Just to be
  213:     %% sure, we will go a little bit higher...
  214: 
  215:     N = 128,
  216:     _ = [begin
  217:              _ = erlang:prepare_loading(Mod, Beam),
  218:              _ = erlang:garbage_collect()
  219:          end || _ <- lists:seq(1, N)],
  220:     ok.
  221: 
  222: call_purged_fun_code_gone(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  223:     run_sys_proc_test(fun call_purged_fun_code_gone_test/1, Config).
  224: 
  225: call_purged_fun_code_gone_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  226:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  227:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  228:     call_purged_fun_test(Priv, Data, code_gone),
  229:     ok.
  230: 
  231: call_purged_fun_code_reload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  232:     run_sys_proc_test(fun call_purged_fun_code_reload_test/1, Config).
  233: 
  234: call_purged_fun_code_reload_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  235:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  236:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  237:     Path = code:get_path(),
  238:     true = code:add_path(Priv),
  239:     try
  240: 	call_purged_fun_test(Priv, Data, code_reload)
  241:     after
  242: 	code:set_path(Path)
  243:     end,
  244:     ok.
  245: 
  246: call_purged_fun_code_there(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  247:     run_sys_proc_test(fun call_purged_fun_code_there_test/1, Config).
  248: 
  249: call_purged_fun_code_there_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  250:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  251:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  252:     call_purged_fun_test(Priv, Data, code_there),
  253:     ok.
  254: 
  255: %% GH-7288: calling a fun defined by a module that had been purged after
  256: %% loading a different version of the same module (and therefore did not
  257: %% inherit the old fun entries) could cause the emulator to crash.
  258: call_purged_fun_code_altered(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  259:     run_sys_proc_test(fun call_purged_fun_code_altered_test/1, Config).
  260: 
  261: call_purged_fun_code_altered_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  262:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  263:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  264:     call_purged_fun_test(Priv, Data, code_altered),
  265:     ok.
  266: 
  267: call_purged_fun_test(Priv, Data, Type) ->
  268:     SrcFile = filename:join(Data, "call_purged_fun_tester.erl"),
  269:     ObjFile = filename:join(Priv, "call_purged_fun_tester.beam"),
  270:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(SrcFile, [binary, report]),
  271:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, ObjFile, Code),
  272: 
  273:     call_purged_fun_tester:do(Priv, Data, Type, []).
  274: 
  275: multi_proc_purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  276:     run_sys_proc_test(fun multi_proc_purge_test/1, Config).
  277: 
  278: multi_proc_purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  279:     %%
  280:     %% Make sure purge requests aren't lost when
  281:     %% purger process is working.
  282:     %%
  283:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  284:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  285:     File1 = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  286:     File2 = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test2"),
  287:     
  288:     {ok,my_code_test} = c:c(File1, [{outdir,Priv}]),
  289:     {ok,my_code_test2} = c:c(File2, [{outdir,Priv}]),
  290:     erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  291:     erlang:delete_module(my_code_test2),
  292: 
  293:     Self = self(),
  294: 
  295:     Fun1 = fun () ->
  296: 		   erts_code_purger:purge(my_code_test),
  297: 		   Self ! {self(), done}
  298: 	   end,
  299:     Fun2 = fun () ->
  300: 		   erts_code_purger:soft_purge(my_code_test2),
  301: 		   Self ! {self(), done}
  302: 	   end,
  303:     Fun3 = fun () ->
  304: 		   erts_code_purger:purge('__nonexisting_module__'),
  305: 		   Self ! {self(), done}
  306: 	   end,
  307:     Fun4 = fun () ->
  308: 		   erts_code_purger:soft_purge('__another_nonexisting_module__'),
  309: 		   Self ! {self(), done}
  310: 	   end,
  311: 
  312:     Pid1 = spawn_link(Fun1),
  313:     Pid2 = spawn_link(Fun2),
  314:     Pid3 = spawn_link(Fun3),
  315:     Pid4 = spawn_link(Fun4),
  316:     Pid5 = spawn_link(Fun1),
  317:     Pid6 = spawn_link(Fun2),
  318:     Pid7 = spawn_link(Fun3),
  319:     receive after 50 -> ok end,
  320:     Pid8 = spawn_link(Fun4),
  321:     Pid9 = spawn_link(Fun1),
  322:     Pid10 = spawn_link(Fun2),
  323:     Pid11 = spawn_link(Fun3),
  324:     Pid12 = spawn_link(Fun4),
  325:     Pid13 = spawn_link(Fun1),
  326:     receive after 50 -> ok end,
  327:     Pid14 = spawn_link(Fun2),
  328:     Pid15 = spawn_link(Fun3),
  329:     Pid16 = spawn_link(Fun4),
  330: 
  331:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> receive {P, done} -> ok end end,
  332: 		  [Pid1, Pid2, Pid3, Pid4, Pid5, Pid6, Pid7, Pid8,
  333: 		   Pid9, Pid10, Pid11, Pid12, Pid13, Pid14, Pid15, Pid16]),
  334:     ok.
  335: 
  336: %% Test the erlang:check_old_code/1 BIF.
  337: t_check_old_code(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  338:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  339:     File = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  340: 
  341:     catch erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  342:     catch erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  343:     catch erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  344: 
  345:     false = erlang:check_old_code(my_code_test),
  346: 
  347:     {ok,my_code_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  348:     {module,my_code_test} = code:load_binary(my_code_test, File, Code),
  349: 
  350:     false = erlang:check_old_code(my_code_test),
  351:     {module,my_code_test} = code:load_binary(my_code_test, File, Code),
  352:     true = erlang:check_old_code(my_code_test),
  353: 
  354:     true = erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  355:     true = erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  356:     true = erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  357: 
  358:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch erlang:check_old_code([])),
  359: 
  360:     ok.
  361: 
  362: external_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  363:     false = erlang:function_exported(another_code_test, x, 1),
  364:     AnotherCodeTest = id(another_code_test),
  365:     ExtFun = fun AnotherCodeTest:x/1,
  366:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch ExtFun(answer)),
  367:     false = erlang:function_exported(another_code_test, x, 1),
  368:     false = lists:member(another_code_test, erlang:loaded()),
  369:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  370:     File = filename:join(Data, "another_code_test"),
  371:     {ok,another_code_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary,report]),
  372:     {module,another_code_test} = erlang:load_module(another_code_test, Code),
  373:     42 = ExtFun(answer),
  374:     ok.
  375: 
  376: get_chunk(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  377:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  378:     File = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  379:     {ok,my_code_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  380: 
  381:     %% Should work.
  382:     Chunk = get_chunk_ok("AtU8", Code),
  383:     Chunk = get_chunk_ok("AtU8", make_sub_binary(Code)),
  384:     Chunk = get_chunk_ok("AtU8", make_unaligned_sub_binary(Code)),
  385: 
  386:     %% Should fail.
  387:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch code:get_chunk(bit_sized_binary(Code), "AtU8")),
  388:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch code:get_chunk(Code, "bad chunk id")),
  389: 
  390:     %% Invalid beam code or missing chunk should return 'undefined'.
  391:     undefined = code:get_chunk(<<"not a beam module">>, "AtU8"),
  392:     undefined = code:get_chunk(Code, "XXXX"),
  393: 
  394:     ok.
  395: 
  396: get_chunk_ok(Chunk, Code) ->
  397:     case code:get_chunk(Code, Chunk) of
  398:         Bin when is_binary(Bin) -> Bin
  399:     end.
  400: 
  401: module_md5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  402:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  403:     File = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  404:     {ok,my_code_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  405: 
  406:     %% Should work.
  407:     Chunk = module_md5_ok(Code),
  408:     Chunk = module_md5_ok(make_sub_binary(Code)),
  409:     Chunk = module_md5_ok(make_unaligned_sub_binary(Code)),
  410: 
  411:     %% Should fail.
  412:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch code:module_md5(bit_sized_binary(Code))),
  413: 
  414:     %% Invalid beam code should return 'undefined'.
  415:     undefined = code:module_md5(<<"not a beam module">>),
  416:     ok.
  417: 
  418: module_md5_ok(Code) ->
  419:     case code:module_md5(Code) of
  420:         Bin when is_binary(Bin), size(Bin) =:= 16 -> Bin
  421:     end.
  422: 
  423: 
  424: constant_pools(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  425:     run_sys_proc_test(fun constant_pools_test/1, Config).
  426: 
  427: constant_pools_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  428:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  429:     File = filename:join(Data, "literals"),
  430:     {ok,literals,Code} = compile:file(File, [report,binary]),
  431:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals,
  432:                                            make_sub_binary(Code)),
  433: 
  434:     %% Initialize.
  435:     A = literals:a(),
  436:     B = literals:b(),
  437:     C = literals:huge_bignum(),
  438:     D = literals:funs(),
  439:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  440:     Self = self(),
  441: 
  442:     %% Have a process WITHOUT old heap that references the literals
  443:     %% in the 'literals' module.
  444:     NoOldHeap = spawn_link(fun() -> no_old_heap(Self) end),
  445:     receive go -> ok end,
  446:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  447:     false = erlang:check_process_code(NoOldHeap, literals),
  448:     erlang:check_process_code(self(), literals),
  449:     true = erlang:purge_module(literals),
  450:     NoOldHeap ! done,
  451:     receive
  452:         {'EXIT',NoOldHeap,{A,B,C,D}} ->
  453:             ok;
  454:         Other_NoOldHeap ->
  455:             ct:fail({unexpected,Other_NoOldHeap})
  456:     end,
  457:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  458: 
  459:     %% Have a process with an inconsistent heap (legal while GC is disabled)
  460:     %% that references the literals in the 'literals' module.
  461:     InconsistentHeap = spawn_link(fun() -> inconsistent_heap(Self) end),
  462:     receive go -> ok end,
  463:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  464:     false = erlang:check_process_code(InconsistentHeap, literals),
  465:     erlang:check_process_code(self(), literals),
  466:     true = erlang:purge_module(literals),
  467:     InconsistentHeap ! done,
  468:     receive
  469:         {'EXIT',InconsistentHeap,{A,B,C}} ->
  470:             ok;
  471:         Other_InconsistentHeap ->
  472:             ct:fail({unexpected,Other_InconsistentHeap})
  473:     end,
  474:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  475: 
  476:     %% Have a process WITH an old heap that references the literals
  477:     %% in the 'literals' module.
  478:     OldHeap = spawn_link(fun() -> old_heap(Self) end),
  479:     receive go -> ok end,
  480:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  481:     false = erlang:check_process_code(OldHeap, literals),
  482:     erlang:check_process_code(self(), literals),
  483:     erlang:purge_module(literals),
  484:     OldHeap ! done,
  485:     receive
  486: 	{'EXIT',OldHeap,{A,B,C,D,[1,2,3|_]=Seq}} when length(Seq) =:= 16 ->
  487: 	    ok
  488:     end,
  489: 
  490:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  491:     %% Have a hibernated process that references the literals
  492:     %% in the 'literals' module.
  493:     {Hib, Mon} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> hibernated(Self) end),
  494:     receive go -> ok end,
  495:     [{heap_size,OldHeapSz},
  496:      {total_heap_size,OldTotHeapSz}] = process_info(Hib, [heap_size,
  497: 							  total_heap_size]),
  498:     OldHeapSz = OldTotHeapSz,
  499:     io:format("OldHeapSz=~p OldTotHeapSz=~p~n", [OldHeapSz, OldTotHeapSz]),
  500:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  501:     false = erlang:check_process_code(Hib, literals),
  502:     erlang:check_process_code(self(), literals),
  503:     erlang:purge_module(literals),
  504:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(5000),
  505:     [{heap_size,HeapSz},
  506:      {total_heap_size,TotHeapSz}] = process_info(Hib, [heap_size,
  507: 						       total_heap_size]),
  508:     io:format("HeapSz=~p TotHeapSz=~p~n", [HeapSz, TotHeapSz]),
  509:     Hib ! hej,
  510:     receive
  511: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Hib, Reason} ->
  512: 	    {undef, [{no_module,
  513: 		      no_function,
  514: 		      [{A,B,C,D,[1,2,3|_]=Seq}], _}]} = Reason,
  515: 	    16 = length(Seq)
  516:     end,
  517:     HeapSz = TotHeapSz, %% Ensure restored to hibernated state...
  518:     true = HeapSz > OldHeapSz,
  519:     ok.
  520: 
  521: no_old_heap(Parent) ->
  522:     A = literals:a(),
  523:     B = literals:b(),
  524:     C = literals:huge_bignum(),
  525:     D = literals:funs(),
  526:     Res = {A,B,C,D},
  527:     Parent ! go,
  528:     receive
  529:         done ->
  530:             exit(Res)
  531:     end.
  532: 
  533: old_heap(Parent) ->
  534:     A = literals:a(),
  535:     B = literals:b(),
  536:     C = literals:huge_bignum(),
  537:     D = literals:funs(),
  538:     Res = {A,B,C,D,lists:seq(1, 16)},
  539:     create_old_heap(),
  540:     Parent ! go,
  541:     receive
  542:         done ->
  543:             exit(Res)
  544:     end.
  545: 
  546: inconsistent_heap(Parent) ->
  547:     A = literals:a(),
  548:     B = literals:b(),
  549:     C = literals:huge_bignum(),
  550:     Res = {A,B,C},
  551:     Parent ! go,
  552: 
  553:     %% Disable the GC and return a tuple whose arity and contents are broken
  554:     BrokenTerm = erts_debug:set_internal_state(inconsistent_heap, start),
  555:     receive
  556:     after 5000 ->
  557:         %% Fix the tuple and enable the GC again
  558:         ok = erts_debug:set_internal_state(inconsistent_heap, BrokenTerm),
  559:         erlang:garbage_collect()
  560:     end,
  561: 
  562:     receive
  563:         done ->
  564:             exit(Res)
  565:     end.
  566: 
  567: hibernated(Parent) ->
  568:     A = literals:a(),
  569:     B = literals:b(),
  570:     C = literals:huge_bignum(),
  571:     D = literals:funs(),
  572:     Res = {A,B,C,D,lists:seq(1, 16)},
  573:     Parent ! go,
  574:     erlang:hibernate(no_module, no_function, [Res]).
  575: 
  576: create_old_heap() ->
  577:     case process_info(self(), [heap_size,total_heap_size]) of
  578:         [{heap_size,Sz},{total_heap_size,Total}] when Sz < Total ->
  579:             ok;
  580:         _ ->
  581:             create_old_heap()
  582:     end.
  583: 
  584: constant_refc_binaries(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  585:     run_sys_proc_test(fun constant_refc_binaries_test/1, Config).
  586: 
  587: constant_refc_binaries_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  588:     wait_for_memory_deallocations(),
  589:     Bef = memory_binary(),
  590:     io:format("Binary data (bytes) before test: ~p\n", [Bef]),
  591: 
  592:     %% Compile the the literals module.
  593:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  594:     File = filename:join(Data, "literals"),
  595:     {ok,literals,Code} = compile:file(File, [report,binary]),
  596: 
  597:     %% Load the code and make sure that the binary is a refc binary.
  598:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  599:     Bin = literals:binary(),
  600:     Sz = byte_size(Bin),
  601:     Check = erlang:md5(Bin),
  602:     io:format("Size of literal refc binary: ~p\n", [Sz]),
  603:     {refc_binary,Sz,_,_} = erts_debug:get_internal_state({binary_info,Bin}),
  604:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  605:     false = erlang:check_process_code(self(), literals),
  606:     true = erlang:purge_module(literals),
  607: 
  608:     %% Now try to provoke a memory leak.
  609:     provoke_mem_leak(10, Code, Check),
  610: 
  611:     %% Calculate the change in allocated binary data.
  612:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  613:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(5000),
  614:     wait_for_memory_deallocations(),
  615:     Aft = memory_binary(),
  616:     io:format("Binary data (bytes) after test: ~p", [Aft]),
  617:     Diff = Aft - Bef,
  618:     if
  619:         Diff < 0 ->
  620:             io:format("~p less bytes", [abs(Diff)]);
  621:         Diff > 0 ->
  622:             io:format("~p more bytes", [Diff]);
  623:         true ->
  624:             ok
  625:     end,
  626: 
  627:     %% Test for leaks. We must accept some natural variations in
  628:     %% the size of allocated binaries.
  629:     if
  630:         Diff > 64*1024 ->
  631:             ct:fail(binary_leak);
  632:         true ->
  633:             ok
  634:     end.
  635: 
  636: memory_binary() ->
  637:     try
  638:         erlang:memory(binary)
  639:     catch
  640:         error:notsup ->
  641:             0
  642:     end.
  643: 
  644: provoke_mem_leak(0, _, _) -> ok;
  645: provoke_mem_leak(N, Code, Check) ->
  646:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  647: 
  648:     %% Create several processes with references to the literal binary.
  649:     Self = self(),
  650:     Pids = [spawn_link(fun() ->
  651:                                create_binaries(Self, NumRefs, Check)
  652:                        end) || NumRefs <- lists:seq(1, 10)],
  653:     [receive {started,Pid} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  654: 
  655:     %% Make the code old and remove references to the constant pool
  656:     %% in all processes.
  657:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  658:     Ms = [spawn_monitor(fun() ->
  659:                                 false = erlang:check_process_code(Pid, literals)
  660:                         end) || Pid <- Pids],
  661:     [receive
  662:          {'DOWN',R,process,P,normal} ->
  663:              ok
  664:      end || {P,R} <- Ms],
  665: 
  666:     %% Purge the code.
  667:     true = erlang:purge_module(literals),
  668: 
  669:     %% Tell the processes that the code has been purged.
  670:     [begin
  671:          monitor(process, Pid),
  672:          Pid ! purged
  673:      end || Pid <- Pids],
  674: 
  675:     %% Wait for all processes to terminate.
  676:     [receive
  677:          {'DOWN',_,process,Pid,normal} ->
  678:              ok
  679:      end || Pid <- Pids],
  680: 
  681:     %% We now expect that the binary has been deallocated.
  682:     provoke_mem_leak(N-1, Code, Check).
  683: 
  684: create_binaries(Parent, NumRefs, Check) ->
  685:     Bin = literals:binary(),
  686:     Bins = lists:duplicate(NumRefs, Bin),
  687:     {bits,Bits} = literals:bits(),
  688:     Parent ! {started,self()},
  689:     receive
  690:         purged ->
  691:             %% The code has been purged. Now make sure that
  692:             %% the binaries haven't been corrupted.
  693:             Check = erlang:md5(Bin),
  694:             [Bin = B || B <- Bins],
  695:             <<42:13,Bin/binary>> = Bits,
  696: 
  697:             %% Remove all references to the binaries
  698:             %% Doing it explicitly like this ensures that
  699:             %% the binaries are gone when the parent process
  700:             %% receives the 'DOWN' message.
  701:             erlang:garbage_collect()
  702:     end.
  703: 
  704: wait_for_memory_deallocations() ->
  705:     try
  706:         erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, deallocations)
  707:     catch
  708:         error:undef ->
  709:             erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  710:             wait_for_memory_deallocations()
  711:     end.
  712: 
  713: fake_literals(_Config) ->
  714:     Mod = fake__literals__module,
  715:     try
  716:         do_fake_literals(Mod)
  717:     after
  718:         _ = code:purge(Mod),
  719:         _ = code:delete(Mod),
  720:         _ = code:purge(Mod),
  721:         _ = code:delete(Mod)
  722:     end,
  723:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(5000),
  724:     ok.
  725: 
  726: do_fake_literals(Mod) ->
  727:     Tid = ets:new(test, []),
  728:     ExtTerms = get_external_terms(),
  729:     Term0 = {self(),make_ref(),Tid,fun() -> ok end,ExtTerms},
  730:     Terms = [begin
  731:                  make_literal_module(Mod, Term0),
  732:                  Mod:term()
  733:              end || _ <- lists:seq(1, 10)],
  734:     verify_lit_terms(Terms, Term0),
  735:     true = ets:delete(Tid),
  736:     ok.
  737: 
  738: make_literal_module(Mod, Term) ->
  739:     Exp = [{term,0}],
  740:     Attr = [],
  741:     Fs = [{function,term,0,2,
  742:            [{label,1},
  743:             {line,[]},
  744:             {func_info,{atom,Mod},{atom,term},0},
  745:             {label,2},
  746:             {move,{literal,Term},{x,0}},
  747:             return]}],
  748:     Asm = {Mod,Exp,Attr,Fs,3},
  749:     {ok,Mod,Beam} = compile:forms(Asm, [from_asm,binary,report]),
  750:     code:load_binary(Mod, atom_to_list(Mod), Beam).
  751: 
  752: verify_lit_terms([H|T], Term) ->
  753:     case H =:= Term of
  754:         true ->
  755:             verify_lit_terms(T, Term);
  756:         false ->
  757:             error({bad_term,H})
  758:     end;
  759: verify_lit_terms([], _) ->
  760:     ok.
  761: 
  762: get_external_terms() ->
  763:     {ok, Peer, Node}= ?CT_PEER(),
  764:     Ref = rpc:call(Node, erlang, make_ref, []),
  765:     Ports = rpc:call(Node, erlang, ports, []),
  766:     Pid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, self, []),
  767:     peer:stop(Peer),
  768:     {Ref,hd(Ports),Pid}.
  769: 
  770: %% OTP-7559: c_p->cp could contain garbage and create a false dependency
  771: %% to a module in a process. (Thanks to Richard Carlsson.)
  772: false_dependency(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  773:     run_sys_proc_test(fun false_dependency_test/1, Config).
  774: 
  775: false_dependency_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  776:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  777:     File = filename:join(Data, "cpbugx"),
  778:     {ok,cpbugx,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary,report]),
  779: 
  780:     do_false_dependency(fun cpbugx:before/0, Code),
  781:     do_false_dependency(fun cpbugx:before2/0, Code),
  782:     do_false_dependency(fun cpbugx:before3/0, Code),
  783: 
  784:     ok.
  785: 
  786: do_false_dependency(Init, Code) ->
  787:     {module,cpbugx} = erlang:load_module(cpbugx, Code),
  788: 
  789:     %% Spawn process. Make sure it has the appropriate init function
  790:     %% and returned. CP should not contain garbage after the return.
  791:     Parent = self(),
  792:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> false_dependency_loop(Parent, Init, true) end),
  793:     receive initialized -> ok end,
  794: 
  795:     %% Reload the module. Make sure the process is still alive.
  796:     {module,cpbugx} = erlang:load_module(cpbugx, Code),
  797:     io:put_chars(binary_to_list(element(2, process_info(Pid, backtrace)))),
  798:     true = is_process_alive(Pid),
  799: 
  800:     %% There should not be any dependency to cpbugx.
  801:     false = erlang:check_process_code(Pid, cpbugx),
  802: 
  803:     %% Kill the process and completely unload the code.
  804:     unlink(Pid), exit(Pid, kill),
  805:     true = erlang:purge_module(cpbugx),
  806:     true = erlang:delete_module(cpbugx),
  807:     true = erlang:purge_module(cpbugx),
  808:     ok.
  809: 
  810: false_dependency_loop(Parent, Init, SendInitAck) ->
  811:     Init(),
  812:     case SendInitAck of
  813:         true -> Parent ! initialized;
  814:         false -> void
  815:                  %% Just send one init-ack. I guess the point of this test
  816:                  %% wasn't to fill parents msg-queue (?). Seen to cause
  817:                  %% out-of-mem (on halfword-vm for some reason) by
  818:                  %% 91 million msg in queue. /sverker
  819:     end,
  820:     receive
  821:         _ -> false_dependency_loop(Parent, Init, false)
  822:     end.
  823: 
  824: coverage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  825:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:purge_module({a,b,c})),
  826:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:check_process_code(not_a_pid, ?MODULE)),
  827:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:check_process_code(self(), [not_a_module])),
  828:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:delete_module([a,b,c])),
  829:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:module_loaded(42)),
  830:     ok.
  831: 
  832: fun_confusion(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  833:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  834:     Src = filename:join(Data, "fun_confusion"),
  835:     Mod = fun_confusion,
  836: 
  837:     %% Load first version of module.
  838:     compile_load(Mod, Src, 1),
  839:     F1 = Mod:f(),
  840:     1 = F1(),
  841: 
  842:     %% Load second version of module.
  843:     compile_load(Mod, Src, 2),
  844:     F2 = Mod:f(),
  845: 
  846:     %% F1 should refer to the old code, not the newly loaded code.
  847:     1 = F1(),
  848:     2 = F2(),
  849:     ok.
  850: 
  851: compile_load(Mod, Src, Ver) ->
  852:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = compile:file(Src, [binary,{d,version,Ver}]),
  853:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "fun_confusion.beam", Code1),
  854:     ok.
  855: 
  856: 
  857: t_copy_literals(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  858:     run_sys_proc_test(fun t_copy_literals_test/1, Config).
  859: 
  860: t_copy_literals_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  861:     %% Compile the the literals module.
  862:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  863:     File = filename:join(Data, "literals"),
  864:     {ok,literals,Code} = compile:file(File, [report,binary]),
  865:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  866: 
  867:     N   = 30,
  868:     Me  = self(),
  869:     %% reload literals code every 567 ms
  870:     Rel = spawn_link(fun() -> reloader(literals,Code,567) end),
  871:     %% add new literal msgs to the loop every 789 ms
  872:     Sat = spawn_link(fun() -> saturate(Me,789) end),
  873:     %% run for 10s
  874:     _   = spawn_link(fun() -> receive after 10000 -> Me ! done end end),
  875:     ok  = chase_msg(N, Me),
  876:     %% cleanup
  877:     Rel ! done,
  878:     Sat ! done,
  879:     %% Trap exit. We don't want to be killed if/when our spawned
  880:     %% processes fail when we remove the literals module...
  881:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  882:     catch erlang:purge_module(literals),
  883:     catch erlang:delete_module(literals),
  884:     catch erlang:purge_module(literals),
  885:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(5000),
  886:     ok  = flush(),
  887:     ok.
  888: 
  889: -define(mod, t_copy_literals_frags).
  890: t_copy_literals_frags(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  891:     run_sys_proc_test(fun t_copy_literals_frags_test/1, Config).
  892: 
  893: t_copy_literals_frags_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  894:     Bin = gen_lit(?mod,[{a,{1,2,3,4,5,6,7}},
  895:                         {b,"hello world"},
  896:                         {c, <<"hello world">>},
  897:                         {d, {"hello world", {1.0, 2.0, <<"some">>, "string"}}},
  898:                         {e, <<"off heap", 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,
  899:                                           8, 9,10,11,12,13,14,15,
  900:                                           0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,
  901:                                           8, 9,10,11,12,13,14,15,
  902:                                           0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,
  903:                                           8, 9,10,11,12,13,14,15,
  904:                                           0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,
  905:                                           8, 9,10,11,12,13,14,15>>},
  906:                         {f, fun ?MODULE:all/0}]),
  907: 
  908:     {module, ?mod} = erlang:load_module(?mod, Bin),
  909:     N = 6000,
  910:     Recv = spawn_opt(fun() -> receive
  911:                                   read ->
  912:                                       io:format("reading"),
  913:                                       literal_receiver()
  914:                               end
  915:                      end, [link,{min_heap_size, 10000}]),
  916:     Switcher = spawn_link(fun() -> literal_switcher() end),
  917:     Pids = [spawn_opt(fun() -> receive
  918:                                    {Pid, go, Recv, N} ->
  919:                                        io:format("sender batch (~w) start ~w~n",[N,self()]),
  920:                                        literal_sender(N,Recv),
  921:                                        Pid ! {self(), ok}
  922:                                end
  923:                       end, [link,{min_heap_size,800}]) || _ <- lists:seq(1,100)],
  924:     _ = [Pid ! {self(), go, Recv, N} || Pid <- Pids],
  925:     %% don't read immediately
  926:     timer:sleep(5),
  927:     Recv ! read,
  928:     Switcher ! {switch,?mod,Bin,[Recv|Pids],200},
  929:     _ = [receive {Pid, ok} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  930:     Switcher ! {self(), done},
  931:     receive {Switcher, ok} -> ok end,
  932:     Recv ! {self(), done},
  933:     receive {Recv, ok} -> ok end,
  934:     catch erlang:purge_module(?mod),
  935:     catch erlang:delete_module(?mod),
  936:     catch erlang:purge_module(?mod),
  937:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(5000),
  938:     ok.
  939: 
  940: literal_receiver() ->
  941:     receive
  942:         {Pid, done} ->
  943:             io:format("reader_done~n"),
  944:             Pid ! {self(), ok};
  945:         {_Pid, msg, [A,B,C,D,E]} ->
  946:             A = ?mod:a(),
  947:             B = ?mod:b(),
  948:             C = ?mod:c(),
  949:             D = ?mod:d(),
  950:             E = ?mod:e(),
  951:             F = ?mod:f(),
  952:             literal_receiver();
  953:         {Pid, sender_confirm} ->
  954:             io:format("sender confirm ~w~n", [Pid]),
  955:             Pid ! {self(), ok},
  956:             literal_receiver()
  957:     end.
  958: 
  959: literal_sender(0, Recv) ->
  960:     Recv ! {self(), sender_confirm},
  961:     receive {Recv, ok} -> ok end;
  962: literal_sender(N, Recv) ->
  963:     Recv ! {self(), msg, [?mod:a(),
  964:                           ?mod:b(),
  965:                           ?mod:c(),
  966:                           ?mod:d(),
  967:                           ?mod:e(),
  968:                           ?mod:f()]},
  969:     literal_sender(N - 1, Recv).
  970: 
  971: literal_switcher() ->
  972:     receive
  973:         {switch,Mod,Bin,Pids,Tmo} ->
  974:             literal_switcher(Mod,Bin,Pids,Tmo)
  975:     end.
  976: literal_switcher(Mod,Bin,Pids,Tmo) ->
  977:     receive
  978:         {Pid,done} ->
  979:             Pid ! {self(),ok}
  980:     after Tmo ->
  981:               io:format("load module ~w~n", [Mod]),
  982:               {module, Mod} = erlang:load_module(Mod,Bin),
  983:               ok = check_and_purge(Pids,Mod),
  984:               io:format("purge complete ~w~n", [Mod]),
  985:               literal_switcher(Mod,Bin,Pids,Tmo+Tmo)
  986:     end.
  987: 
  988: check_and_purge([],Mod) ->
  989:     erlang:purge_module(Mod),
  990:     ok;
  991: check_and_purge(Pids,Mod) ->
  992:     io:format("purge ~w~n", [Mod]),
  993:     Tag = make_ref(),
  994:     _ = [begin
  995:              erlang:check_process_code(Pid,Mod,[{async,{Tag,Pid}}])
  996:          end || Pid <- Pids],
  997:     Retry = check_and_purge_receive(Pids,Tag,[]),
  998:     check_and_purge(Retry,Mod).
  999: 
 1000: check_and_purge_receive([Pid|Pids],Tag,Retry) ->
 1001:     receive
 1002:         {check_process_code, {Tag, Pid}, false} ->
 1003:             check_and_purge_receive(Pids,Tag,Retry);
 1004:         {check_process_code, {Tag, Pid}, true} ->
 1005:             check_and_purge_receive(Pids,Tag,[Pid|Retry])
 1006:     end;
 1007: check_and_purge_receive([],_,Retry) ->
 1008:     Retry.
 1009: 
 1010: 
 1011: gen_lit(Module,Terms) ->
 1012:     FunStrings = [lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w() -> ~w.~n", [F,Term]))||{F,Term}<-Terms],
 1013:     FunForms = function_forms(FunStrings),
 1014:     Forms    = [{attribute,erl_anno:new(1),module,Module},
 1015:                 {attribute,erl_anno:new(2),export,[FA || {FA,_} <- FunForms]}] ++
 1016:                [Function || {_, Function} <- FunForms],
 1017:     {ok, Module, Bin} = compile:forms(Forms),
 1018:     Bin.
 1019: 
 1020: function_forms([]) -> [];
 1021: function_forms([S|Ss]) ->
 1022:     {ok, Ts,_} = erl_scan:string(S),
 1023:     {ok, Form} = erl_parse:parse_form(Ts),
 1024:     Fun   = element(3, Form),
 1025:     Arity = element(4, Form),
 1026:     [{{Fun,Arity}, Form}|function_forms(Ss)].
 1027: 
 1028: chase_msg(0, Pid) ->
 1029:     chase_loop(Pid);
 1030: chase_msg(N, Master) ->
 1031:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> chase_msg(N - 1,Master) end),
 1032:     chase_loop(Pid).
 1033: 
 1034: chase_loop(Pid) ->
 1035:     receive
 1036:         done ->
 1037:             Pid ! done,
 1038:             ok;
 1039:         {_From,Msg} ->
 1040:             Pid ! {self(), Msg},
 1041:             ok = traverse(Msg),
 1042:             chase_loop(Pid)
 1043:     end.
 1044: 
 1045: saturate(Pid,Time) ->
 1046:     Es = [msg1,msg2,msg3,msg4,msg5],
 1047:     Msg = [literals:E()||E <- Es],
 1048:     Pid ! {self(), Msg},
 1049:     receive
 1050:         done -> ok
 1051:     after Time ->
 1052:               saturate(Pid,Time)
 1053:     end.
 1054: 
 1055: traverse([]) -> ok;
 1056: traverse([H|T]) ->
 1057:     ok = traverse(H),
 1058:     traverse(T);
 1059: traverse(T) when is_tuple(T) -> ok;
 1060: traverse(B) when is_binary(B) -> ok;
 1061: traverse(I) when is_integer(I) -> ok;
 1062: traverse(#{ 1 := V1, b := V2 }) ->
 1063:     ok = traverse(V1),
 1064:     ok = traverse(V2),
 1065:     ok.
 1066: 
 1067: 
 1068: reloader(Mod,Code,Time) ->
 1069:     receive
 1070:         done -> ok
 1071:     after Time ->
 1072:               code:purge(Mod),
 1073:               {module,Mod} = erlang:load_module(Mod, Code),
 1074:               reloader(Mod,Code,Time)
 1075:     end.
 1076: 
 1077: erl_544(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1078:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
 1079:         utf8 ->
 1080:             {ok, CWD} = file:get_cwd(),
 1081:             try
 1082:                 Mod = erl_544,
 1083:                 FileName = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
 1084:                 Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1085:                 Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1086:                 {ok, FileContent} = file:read_file(filename:join(Data,
 1087:                                                                  FileName)),
 1088:                 Dir = filename:join(Priv, [16#2620,16#2620,16#2620]),
 1089:                 File = filename:join(Dir, FileName),
 1090:                 io:format("~ts~n", [File]),
 1091:                 ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
 1092:                 ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
 1093:                 ok = file:write_file(File, [FileContent]),
 1094:                 {ok, Mod} = compile:file(File),
 1095:                 Res1 = (catch Mod:err()),
 1096:                 io:format("~p~n", [Res1]),
 1097:                 {'EXIT', {err, [{Mod, err, 0, Info1}|_]}} = Res1,
 1098:                 File = proplists:get_value(file, Info1),
 1099:                 Me = self(),
 1100:                 Go = make_ref(),
 1101:                 Tester = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1102:                                             Mod:wait(Me, Go),
 1103:                                             Mod:err()
 1104:                                     end),
 1105:                 receive Go -> ok end,
 1106:                 Res2 = process_info(Tester, current_stacktrace),
 1107:                 io:format("~p~n", [Res2]),
 1108:                 {current_stacktrace, Stack} = Res2,
 1109:                 [{Mod, wait, 2, Info2}|_] = Stack,
 1110:                 File = proplists:get_value(file, Info2),
 1111:                 StackFun = fun(_, _, _) -> false end,
 1112:                 FormatFun = fun (Term, _) -> io_lib:format("~tp", [Term]) end,
 1113:                 Formatted =
 1114:                     erl_error:format_stacktrace(1, Stack, StackFun, FormatFun),
 1115:                 true = is_list(Formatted),
 1116:                 ok
 1117:             after
 1118:                 ok = file:set_cwd(CWD)
 1119:             end,
 1120:             ok;
 1121:         _Enc ->
 1122:             {skipped, "Only run when native file name encoding is utf8"}
 1123:     end.
 1124: 
 1125: %% Test that the copying of literals to a process during purging of
 1126: %% literals will cause the process to be killed if the max heap size
 1127: %% is exceeded.
 1128: max_heap_size(_Config) ->
 1129:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1130:     Value = [I || I <- lists:seq(1, 5000)],
 1131:     Code = gen_lit(Mod, [{term,Value}]),
 1132:     {module,Mod} = erlang:load_module(Mod, Code),
 1133:     SpawnOpts = [monitor,
 1134:                  {max_heap_size,
 1135:                   #{size=>1024,
 1136:                     kill=>true,
 1137:                     error_logger=>true}}],
 1138:     {Pid,Ref} = spawn_opt(fun() ->
 1139:                                   max_heap_size_proc(Mod)
 1140:                           end, SpawnOpts),
 1141:     receive
 1142:         {'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,Reason} ->
 1143:             killed = Reason;
 1144:         Other ->
 1145:             ct:fail({unexpected_message,Other})
 1146:     after 10000 ->
 1147:             ct:fail({process_did_not_die, Pid, erlang:process_info(Pid)})
 1148:     end.
 1149: 
 1150: max_heap_size_proc(Mod) ->
 1151:     Value = Mod:term(),
 1152:     code:delete(Mod),
 1153:     code:purge(Mod),
 1154:     receive
 1155:         _ -> Value
 1156:     end.
 1157: 
 1158: check_process_code_signal_order(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1159:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 1160:     process_flag(priority, high),
 1161:     {module,versions} = erlang:load_module(versions, compile_version(1, Config)),
 1162:     Pid = spawn_opt(versions, loop, [], [{scheduler, 1}]),
 1163:     true = erlang:delete_module(versions),
 1164:     true = erlang:check_process_code(Pid, versions),
 1165:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1166:     spam_signals(Pid, 10000),
 1167:     %% EXIT signal *should* arrive...
 1168:     exit(Pid, kill),
 1169:     %% ... before CPC signal...
 1170:     async = erlang:check_process_code(Pid, versions, [{async, Ref}]),
 1171:     %% ... which means that the result of the check_process_code *should* be 'false'...
 1172:     false = busy_wait_cpc_res(Ref),
 1173:     ok.
 1174: 
 1175: busy_wait_cpc_res(Ref) ->
 1176:     receive
 1177: 	{check_process_code, Ref, Res} ->
 1178: 	    Res
 1179:     after 0 ->
 1180: 	    busy_wait_cpc_res(Ref)
 1181:     end.
 1182: 
 1183: spam_signals(P, N) when N =< 0 ->
 1184:     ok;
 1185: spam_signals(P, N) ->
 1186:     link(P),
 1187:     unlink(P),
 1188:     spam_signals(P, N-2).
 1189: 
 1190: check_process_code_dirty_exec_proc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1191:     Pid = spawn(fun () ->
 1192: 			erts_debug:dirty_io(wait, 10000)
 1193: 		end),
 1194:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1195:     false = erlang:check_process_code(Pid, non_existing_module),
 1196:     {status, running} = process_info(Pid, status),
 1197:     exit(Pid, kill),
 1198:     false = is_process_alive(Pid),
 1199:     ok.
 1200: 
 1201: %% OTP-18016: When loading a module over itself, a race in fun loading made it
 1202: %% possible to call a local fun before the module was fully reloaded.
 1203: call_fun_before_load(Config) ->
 1204:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1205:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1206:     Path = code:get_path(),
 1207:     true = code:add_path(Priv),
 1208:     try
 1209:         SrcFile = filename:join(Data, "call_fun_before_load.erl"),
 1210:         ObjFile = filename:join(Priv, "call_fun_before_load.beam"),
 1211:         {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(SrcFile, [binary, report]),
 1212:         {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, ObjFile, Code),
 1213: 
 1214:         ok = call_fun_before_load:run(ObjFile, Code),
 1215: 
 1216:         code:purge(call_fun_before_load)
 1217:     after
 1218:         code:set_path(Path),
 1219:         code:delete(call_fun_before_load),
 1220:         code:purge(call_fun_before_load)
 1221:     end,
 1222:     ok.
 1223: 
 1224: %% Utilities.
 1225: 
 1226: make_sub_binary(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 1227:     {_,B1} = split_binary(list_to_binary([0,1,3,Bin,4,5,6,7]), 3),
 1228:     {B,_} = split_binary(B1, size(Bin)),
 1229:     B;
 1230: make_sub_binary(List) ->
 1231:     make_sub_binary(list_to_binary(List)).
 1232: 
 1233: make_unaligned_sub_binary(Bin0) ->
 1234:     Bin1 = <<0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5>>,
 1235:     Sz = size(Bin0),
 1236:     <<0:3,Bin:Sz/binary,31:5>> = id(Bin1),
 1237:     Bin.
 1238: 
 1239: %% Add 1 bit to the size of the binary.
 1240: bit_sized_binary(Bin0) ->
 1241:     Bin = <<Bin0/binary,1:1>>,
 1242:     BitSize = bit_size(Bin),
 1243:     BitSize = 8*size(Bin) + 1,
 1244:     Bin.
 1245: 
 1246: flush() ->
 1247:     receive _ -> flush() after 0 -> ok end.
 1248: 
 1249: id(I) -> I.
 1250: 
 1251: 
 1252: run_sys_proc_test(Test, Config) ->
 1253:     OSRL = erlang:system_info(outstanding_system_requests_limit),
 1254:     
 1255:     TestLowOSRL = case OSRL < 10 of
 1256:                       true -> 1;
 1257:                       false -> 5
 1258:                   end,
 1259: 
 1260:     io:format("Running with the default outstanding request limit of ~p~n", [OSRL]),
 1261:     Res1 = Test(Config),
 1262:     io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Res1]),
 1263:     try
 1264:         %% Run again with low limit and many processes...
 1265:         Procs = case erlang:system_info(process_limit) of
 1266:                     PLim when PLim < 20000 ->
 1267:                         erlang:system_info(process_limit) div 2;
 1268:                     _ ->
 1269:                         10000
 1270:                 end,
 1271:         erlang:system_flag(outstanding_system_requests_limit, TestLowOSRL),
 1272:         io:format("Running with outstanding request limit of ~p~n", [TestLowOSRL]),
 1273:         Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1274:                                spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end)
 1275:                        end, lists:seq(1, Procs)),
 1276:         Res2 = Test(Config),
 1277:         lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 1278:                               unlink(P),
 1279:                               exit(P, kill)
 1280:                       end, Ps),
 1281:         lists:foreach(fun (P) -> is_process_alive(P) end, Ps),
 1282:         io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Res2]),
 1283:         {Res1, Res2}
 1284:     after
 1285:         TestLowOSRL = erlang:system_flag(outstanding_system_requests_limit, OSRL)
 1286:     end.
